column4: i have a really funky problem, my computer wont work right if i dont boot to SU mode and init 5.....if anyone thinks they can help, ill explain in more detail, but its complicated
help would be appreciated :(
either you give a better error description how it is "funky" or no one can help you
it happens in 3 steps....first boot it locks after login and splash, second boot @ splash, 3rd @ graphical init
what "splash"?
the gnome login splash screen
you mean gdm?
correct
ive run fsck, and removed/reinstalled gdm
that's not what I asked. is your "gnome login splash screen" gdm?
yes, i believe so--its that narrow image that comes up and shows stuff loading, right before the desktop fully appears
after you logged in?
always locking at the same place or different ones?
first boot, after desktop shows, second boot, it locks after login, 3rd and subsequent boots it locks as SOON as it switches to tty7
I guess either you have a heat problem or the wrong X driver
heat is a possibility, although im confused as to why that would occur differently on different boots, and reset when i use init 5
my mistake, nvidia-glx-new
try nv drivers, try vesa
no one can really help you with your error unless you reproduce it (or fix it) with a Free driver: everyone will always suspect the nvidia POS driver :)
actually, now it just never gets past switching to tty7, where it goes to graphical mode
I really suspect heat. videocard heat that is
any thoughts on why manually switching to runlevel 5 gets around the issue?
not really, sorry
alright, thanks for yer help, it saves me a lot of trouble
